<tr>
<td class="rowhead1">Summary</td><td colspan="99">Ordinary differential equations, transforms and Fourier series with applications to engineering. Linear differential equations, homogeneous and non-homogeneous equations, particular solutions for standard forcings; Laplace transforms and applications; standard Fourier series, half range sine and cosine series, complex form; convergence of Fourier series, differentiation and integration of Fourier series. Introduction to Partial Differential Equations.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td class="rowhead1">Course description</td><td colspan="99">
    
    Differential Equations:<br/>
- Linear Differential Equations 1 lecture<br/>
- Linear constant coefficient Differential Equations 3  lectures<br/>
- Second order linear constant coefficient differential  equations, forcing and damping 2 lectures<br/>
<br/>
Laplace Transforms:<br/>
- Definition, simple transforms, properties, inverse and shift theorem 3 lectures<br/>
- Solution of ODEs 3 lectures<br/>
<br/>
Fourier Series:<br/>
- Fourier series, coefficients, even/odd functions, linearity,  convergence 2 lectures<br/>
- Full range, half-range 2 lectures<br/>
- Integration and differentiation of Fourier series 1 lecture<br/>
<br/>
Partial Differential Equations:<br/>
- Wave equation, Heat or diffusion equation, Laplace equation  1 lecture<br/>
- Solution of wave equation, D'alembert solution, separated  solution  2 lectures<br/>
<br/>
</td>
</tr>

<!-- Learning outcomes, FB 1/4/11 add other learning outcomes for ECA -->
<table class="sitstablegrid">
<caption>Learning Outcomes</caption>
<tr>
<td>
    On completion of this course, the student will be able to:
    <ol style="font-family:inherit;font-size:inherit;">
<li>Calculate the solution of engineering problems described by linear, constant coefficient first and higher order differential equations</li><li>Analyse and interpret the solutions to draw conclusions on the system behaviour</li><li>Apply the Laplace transform to solve systems of linear, constant coefficient differential equations and to evaluate the stability of dynamic systems</li><li>Use Fourier series analysis to approximate periodic functions, solve differential equations and analyse the response of systems to periodic forcing</li><li> Distinguish between ordinary and partial differential equations and solve special cases of the wave equation</li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

2.	Advanced Modern Engineering Mathematics by Glyn James, <br/>
        Prentice Hall, ISBN 978-0-273-71923-6<br/>
</td></tr>
</table>
